Textarea

Use the text area component to add a text field that can contain multiple lines of text.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-textarea

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-textarea

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-textarea/src/scss/textarea";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Textarea

Basic text area

      <textarea class="vl-textarea"
    id="textarea-1"
    name="textarea-1"
    value=""
    cols="40"
    rows="4"></textarea>

Textarea block

Stretches the text area to the width of the parent container

      <textarea class="vl-textarea vl-textarea--block"
    id="textarea-2"
    name="textarea-2"
    value=""
    cols="40"
    rows="4"></textarea>

Textarea error

The text area gets a red border. You can add an extra form error element below the text area.

      <textarea class="vl-textarea vl-textarea--error"
    id="textarea-3"
    name="textarea-3"
    value=""
    cols="40"
    rows="4"></textarea>

Textarea disabled

The text area is not accessible for a user to make changes or add text. Add the [disabled] attribute to disable all user interaction.

      <textarea class="vl-textarea vl-textarea--disabled"
    id="textarea-4"
    name="textarea-4"
    value=""
    cols="40"
    rows="4" disabled></textarea>

Accessibility

Always link a text area to a label element. Don't rely on color alone when validating a text area in a form. Add a descriptive error message.
